title: Longtime Harvard Kennedy School faculty member Nicholas Burns to return to HKS after serving as U.S. envoy to China | Harvard Kennedy School
snippet: — Nicholas Burns, who until recently served as the United States ambassador to the People’s Republic of China, will rejoin the Harvard Kennedy School faculty in April, Dean Jeremy M. Weinstein announced today.

title: BIOGRAPHY: Nicholas Burns
snippet: Nicholas Burns is Professor of the Practice of Diplomacy and International Politics at the Harvard Kennedy School of Government. He is Director of the Future of Diplomacy Project and Faculty Chair for the Programs on the Middle East and on India ...

title: R. Nicholas Burns - Wikipedia
snippet: He served as the United States ambassador to China from 2022 to 2025. He is now Roy and Barbara Goodman Family Professor of the Practice of Diplomacy and International Relations at Harvard John F.

title: Nicholas Burns | The Cohen Group
snippet: US Ambassador to China (2021–2025) Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs (2005–2008) US Ambassador to NATO (2001–2005) US Ambassador to Greece (1997–2001) Ambassador Nicholas Burns served as US Ambassador to China from 2021 ...

title: Nicholas Burns - NACDS Annual 2026
snippet: He will return to Harvard in the spring of 2025 as the Roy and Barbara Goodman Family Professor of the Practice of Diplomacy and International Politics at Harvard University’s Kennedy School of Government.
